channel.title: Im patching my day away.. but
channel.description:
Hey.
So FINALLY got it and already patched a bit but i run into a thing... when i try mak a sequencer run it just run thru the steps on and then hang on last note... how do i get it to run over and over again :)

item.title: Im patching my day away.. but
item.dc:creator: @Kalle challester
item.description:
@Kalle wrote:

I do have somethings that would be nice like dedicated attenuators to modulation amount on pitch / freg / reso and so.. tried with one of the "mixer" objects but i guess it have a to high value at max so it was very fidly to get to work... anyways its all still new so now when the users gets it in hand im sure we will se some amazng ideas and so

Read full topic
item.source: Im patching my day away.. but

item.title: Im patching my day away.. but
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

ah the tutorials/demos and help are really useful... they contain quite a few things 'tips n tricks' that possibly are not obvious. I learnt quite a few things from some of them.

I know you wanna just patch, but its worth taking a quick browse thru them, so you know whats there (and can come back to later)
similarly when you use a new object for first time, just quickly the checkout the help patch... and see if anything interesting is there. ... sometimes (like Max/Msp) that can also save you some effort, you can copy n paste bits

( we are also keen for examples, if you can see areas where we are missing stuff)

anyway, happy patching

Read full topic

i have not really runned into the tutorials im so much a guy that jumps right out in the deep end i never saved it continued with making other stuff i will have a go at that tutorial of it goes all in goat i come back to u

did you check tutorials/26_simple_sequencer ... you could cut n paste that into your patch as well.

item.title: Im patching my day away.. but
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

depends on how you have written your sequencer have you checked out tutorials/26_simple_sequencer.
(my random guess is your counter does not match your sel object length?)

note: (since 1.0.3) the special trick I use to ensure it starts on step 1, and not step 2 at start up.

Read full topic
